what: The best assistant for an academic
title: The best assistant for an academic
text: RforMD aims provide functions personal use. Surely, academic medicine, can use . open improve. hesitate requests/issue reports.

title: The best assistant for an academic
text: can install development version RforMD GitHub :
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("AliGunerMD/RforMD") library("RforMD")

title: The best assistant for an academic
text: idea package comes personal needs. finalfit package one useful package researcher works medicine. provides great functionalities. just want improve parts , , try extent save time. Later, also added functions flextable idea. make faster totally reproducible Word tables. happy html output, try gt, gtsummary, gtExtras packages. analysis starts exploration data. Among many options like summary(), str(), dplyr::glimpse(), skimr::skim(); prefer finalfit::ff_glimpse() modifications.
code: # remotes::install_github("AliGunerMD/RforMD", force = TRUE) library(RforMD) library(palmerpenguins) library(tidyverse)  strata <- "species" table_vars_penguins <- penguins %>%          select(-species) %>%          names()   # library(finalfit) # library(flextable)

title: The best assistant for an academic
code: ag_ff_glimpse(penguins, type = "cont")

title: The best assistant for an academic
code: ag_ff_glimpse(penguins, type = "cat")

title: The best assistant for an academic
code: ag_ff_glimpse(penguins, type = "cat", strata = "sex", missing = TRUE)

title: The best assistant for an academic
code: ag_shapiro(penguins, strata = strata, table_vars = table_vars_penguins) #> Shapiro-Wilk test results for normality within strata: #> Checked variables: bill_length_mm, bill_depth_mm, flipper_length_mm, body_mass_g, year #> Stratified by: species #> Non-normally distributed variables: body_mass_g, year, bill_length_mm, bill_depth_mm, flipper_length_mm #> [1] "body_mass_g"       "year"              "bill_length_mm"    #> [4] "bill_depth_mm"     "flipper_length_mm" ag_shapiro_results(penguins, strata = strata, table_vars = table_vars_penguins,                    scientific = TRUE) %>%          ag_flex()

title: The best assistant for an academic
code: ag_qq_plots(penguins, strata = strata, table_vars = table_vars_penguins)

title: The best assistant for an academic
code: ag_ff_summary(penguins, strata = strata, table_vars = table_vars_penguins) %>%          ag_flex()

title: The best assistant for an academic
code: ag_ff_summary(penguins, strata = strata, table_vars = table_vars_penguins) %>%          ag_ff_relocate(order = "TGP") %>%          ag_flex() #> Relocated columns:label -- levels -- Total -- Adelie -- Chinstrap -- Gentoo -- p

title: The best assistant for an academic
code: ag_ff_summary(penguins, strata = strata, table_vars = table_vars_penguins) %>%          ag_ff_relocate(order = "TGP") %>%          ag_ff_columns(levels = TRUE) %>%          ag_flex() #> Relocated columns:label -- levels -- Total -- Adelie -- Chinstrap -- Gentoo -- p #> Manual check may be needed for some levels.

title: The best assistant for an academic
code: penguins_names <- c(         "island" = "Island",         "bill_length_mm" = "Bill length (mm)",         "bill_depth_mm" = "Bill depth (mm)",         "flipper_length_mm" = "Flipper length (mm)",         "body_mass_g" = "Body mass (g)",         "sex" = "Sex",         "year" = "Year" )  ag_ff_summary(penguins, strata = strata, table_vars = table_vars_penguins) %>%          ag_ff_relocate(order = "TGP") %>%          ag_ff_columns(levels = TRUE) %>%          ag_ff_labels(use_vector = TRUE, vector_name = penguins_names) %>%          ag_flex() #> Relocated columns:label -- levels -- Total -- Adelie -- Chinstrap -- Gentoo -- p #> Manual check may be needed for some levels. #> A vector for variable names was used to rename labels. summary_flextable <- ag_ff_summary(penguins, strata = strata, table_vars = table_vars_penguins) %>%          ag_ff_relocate(order = "TGP") %>%          ag_ff_columns(levels = TRUE) %>%          ag_ff_labels(use_vector = TRUE, vector_name = penguins_names) %>%          ag_flex() #> Relocated columns:label -- levels -- Total -- Adelie -- Chinstrap -- Gentoo -- p #> Manual check may be needed for some levels. #> A vector for variable names was used to rename labels.

title: The best assistant for an academic
code: summary_flextable %>%          ag_flex_header_labels(.dataset = penguins, strata = "species") #> Because custom = FALSE, original stratas will be used.

title: The best assistant for an academic
code: summary_flextable %>%          ag_flex_header_labels(.dataset = penguins, strata = "species") %>%          ag_flex_center()  #> Because custom = FALSE, original stratas will be used.

title: The best assistant for an academic
code: summary_flextable %>%          ag_flex_header_labels(.dataset = penguins, strata = "species") %>%          ag_flex_center() %>%          ag_flex_title(1, "Characteristics of Penguins dataset") #> Because custom = FALSE, original stratas will be used.

title: The best assistant for an academic
code: abbr_vector <- c(         "mm" = "Milimeter",         "g" = "Gram" )  summary_flextable %>%          ag_flex_header_labels(.dataset = penguins, strata = "species") %>%          ag_flex_center() %>%          ag_flex_title(1, "Characteristics of Penguins dataset") %>%          ag_flex_abbr(abbr = abbr_vector)  #> Because custom = FALSE, original stratas will be used.

title: The best assistant for an academic
code: my_random_foot <- "Palmerpenguins provided a great dataset for data exploration & visualization, as an alternative to iris."  summary_flextable %>%          ag_flex_header_labels(.dataset = penguins, strata = "species") %>%          ag_flex_center() %>%          ag_flex_title(1, "Characteristics of Penguins dataset") %>%          ag_flex_abbr(abbr = abbr_vector) %>%          ag_flex_footnote(my_random_foot)  #> Because custom = FALSE, original stratas will be used.

title: The best assistant for an academic
code: summary_flextable %>%          ag_flex_header_labels(.dataset = penguins, strata = "species") %>%          ag_flex_center() %>%          ag_flex_title(1, "Characteristics of Penguins dataset") %>%          ag_flex_abbr(abbr = abbr_vector) %>%          ag_flex_footnote(my_random_foot) %>%          ag_flex_hline() #> Because custom = FALSE, original stratas will be used.

what: Any flextable function can be added
title: The best assistant for an academic
code: summary_flextable %>%          ag_flex_header_labels(.dataset = penguins, strata = "species") %>%          ag_flex_center() %>%          ag_flex_title(1, "Characteristics of Penguins dataset") %>%          ag_flex_abbr(abbr = abbr_vector) %>%          ag_flex_footnote(my_random_foot) %>%          ag_flex_hline() %>%           flextable::fontsize(size = 7, part = "all") #> Because custom = FALSE, original stratas will be used.

title: The best assistant for an academic
text: saved ““(my_output_path, paste0(format(Sys.time(),”%Y%m%d_%H%M”),“” , ”Table”, n , “.docx”)))“”

what: Generate a scaled color palette — ag_colors_scale
title: Generate a scaled color palette — ag_colors_scale
text: function generates scaled color palette based specified color.

title: Generate a scaled color palette — ag_colors_scale
code: ag_colors_scale(color, num_colors = 8, start = 1, end = 0)

title: Generate a scaled color palette — ag_colors_scale
text: color color create palette . Options include "gray", "red", "blue", "green", "orange", "cyan", "magenta", "yellow". num_colors number colors palette. Default 8. start starting value color scale. Default 1. Used gray scale. end ending value color scale. Default 0. Used gray scale.

title: Generate a scaled color palette — ag_colors_scale
text: vector colors representing scaled color palette.

title: Generate a scaled color palette — ag_colors_scale
text: Ali Guner

title: Generate a scaled color palette — ag_colors_scale
code: if (FALSE) { ag_colors_scale("yellow", 1) ag_colors_scale("gray", 255) }

code: ag_colors_standard(palette_name = NULL)

title: Standardized colors for across projects — ag_colors_standard
text: palette_name character string specifying name desired color palette. NULL (default), palette randomly selected.

title: Standardized colors for across projects — ag_colors_standard
text: vector representing either selected color palette randomly chosen color palette.

title: Standardized colors for across projects — ag_colors_standard
Standardized colors for across projects — ag_colors_standard
code: # Select a specific palette ag_colors_standard("greens") #> [1] "#F7FCF5" "#E5F5E0" "#C7E9C0" "#A1D99B" "#74C476" "#41AB5D" "#238B45" #> [8] "#005A32" ag_colors_standard("greens")[4] #> [1] "#A1D99B"  # Randomly select a color from any palette ag_colors_standard() #> [1] "#DEEBF7"

what: Create an Excel File for Variables Name — ag_create_excel
title: Create an Excel File for Variables Name — ag_create_excel
text: function creates Excel file column names main dataset.

title: Create an Excel File for Variables Name — ag_create_excel
code: ag_create_excel(   dataset = analysis_dataset,   excel_path = "_Data/Variables.xlsx" )

title: Create an Excel File for Variables Name — ag_create_excel
text: dataset dataset extract column names . Default 'analysis_dataset'. excel_path path filename Excel file. Default "_Data/Variables.xlsx".

title: Create an Excel File for Variables Name — ag_create_excel
text: Saves .xlsx file path.

title: Create an Excel File for Variables Name — ag_create_excel
text: Ali Guner

title: Create an Excel File for Variables Name — ag_create_excel
code: if (FALSE) { #' ag_create_excel(dataset = iris) ag_create_excel(dataset = penguins, excel_path = "MyExcelFile.xlsx") }

title: Create Project Folders — ag_create_project_folders
text: function automates creation essential folder structures new R project. sets main directories "_Codes," "_Outputs," "_Data," along subdirectories, subfolders, necessary files organizing project efficiently. function performs following steps: 1. Creates main folders: "_Codes," "_Outputs," "_Data." 2. Sets subfolders within "_Codes," including "_Functions." 3. Creates README file within "_Codes" named "00 README.md" project documentation. 4. Sets subfolders within "_Outputs," including "_Figures" "_Tables." 5. Sets subfolders within "_Data," including "_Raw" "_Processed." 6. Checks deletes single .qmd file main directory user confirmation. 7. Inserts new .qmd template file using ag_generate_template_quarto() moves "_Codes" folder "01 initial.qmd." #' function designed used right creating new R project via "New Project" project creation method.

title: Create Project Folders — ag_create_project_folders
code: ag_create_project_folders()

title: Create Project Folders — ag_create_project_folders
code: if (FALSE) { # Example usage ag_create_project_folders() }

what: Adjusts columns for variables in ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_columns
title: Adjusts columns for variables in ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_columns
text: function adjusts column values ag_ff_summary table. Converts parametric values (Total Groups columns, whichever present) Mean ± SD, Median (Q1- Q3) Also clean levels levels argument TRUE.

title: Adjusts columns for variables in ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_columns
code: ag_ff_columns(.data, levels = FALSE, remove_no = FALSE)

title: Adjusts columns for variables in ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_columns
text: .data input ag_ff_summary table. levels Clean levels, default FALSE. remove_no remove rows levels , delete yes. Default FALSE.

title: Adjusts columns for variables in ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_columns
text: modified ag_ff_summary table adjusted column values.

title: Adjusts columns for variables in ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_columns
text: Ali Guner

title: Adjusts columns for variables in ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_columns
code: if (FALSE) { table_vars_1 <- penguins %>% dplyr::select(-species) %>% names()  ag_ff_summary(penguins, "species", table_vars_1) %>% ag_ff_relocate("TGP") %>% ag_ff_columns(levels = TRUE)  table_vars_2 <- iris %>% dplyr::select(-Species) %>% names()  ag_ff_summary(iris, "Species", table_vars_2) %>% ag_ff_relocate("TGP") %>% ag_ff_columns() }

what: Enhanced ff_glimpse Function with FlexTable Output — ag_ff_glimpse
title: Enhanced ff_glimpse Function with FlexTable Output — ag_ff_glimpse
text: function provides enhanced version ff_glimpse function `finalfit` package. generates summary table additional information levels, missing values, quartiles, mean, standard deviation, . output form `flextable` object, allows easy customization formatting. #'

title: Enhanced ff_glimpse Function with FlexTable Output — ag_ff_glimpse
code: ag_ff_glimpse(   .dataset,   strata = NULL,   table_vars = NULL,   type = NULL,   missing = FALSE,   levels_cut = 10,   ... )

title: Enhanced ff_glimpse Function with FlexTable Output — ag_ff_glimpse
text: .dataset input .data. strata variable used stratification. Default `NULL`. table_vars variables include summary table. Default `NULL`, includes variables .data. type type variables include summary table. Valid values `NULL` (default), "cat" (categorical), "cont" (continuous). missing Logical indicating whether include category missing values stratified evaluation Default `FALSE`. levels_cut maximum number levels display categorical variables. Default 10. ... Additional arguments passed `ag_flex()` function.

title: Enhanced ff_glimpse Function with FlexTable Output — ag_ff_glimpse
text: `flextable` object containing summary table.

title: Enhanced ff_glimpse Function with FlexTable Output — ag_ff_glimpse
text: Ali Guner

title: Enhanced ff_glimpse Function with FlexTable Output — ag_ff_glimpse
code: if (FALSE) { library(palmerpenguins) ag_ff_glimpse(penguins, type = "cont") ag_ff_glimpse(penguins, strata = "sex", missing = TRUE, type = "cat") }

what: Rename labels of a ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_labels
title: Rename labels of a ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_labels
text: function renames labels ag_ff_summary table based vector old new names Excel file. can define old names new names inside R chunk. using external excel file convenient. Variables.xlsx file, consider using ag_create_excel

title: Rename labels of a ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_labels
code: ag_ff_labels(   .data,   use_vector = TRUE,   vector_name = NULL,   use_excel = FALSE,   excel_path = "_Data/Variables.xlsx",   excel_old_names = "original",   excel_new_names = NULL,   add_units = FALSE )

title: Rename labels of a ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_labels
text: .data ag_ff_summary table modified. use_vector Logical value indicating whether use vector renaming labels. Default TRUE. vector_name name vector containing old new label names. Required use_vector = TRUE. use_excel Logical value indicating whether use Excel file renaming labels. Default FALSE. excel_path path Excel file containing old new label names. Required use_excel = TRUE. excel_old_names name column Excel file containing old label names. Default "original". excel_new_names name column Excel file containing new label names. Required use_excel = TRUE.

title: Rename labels of a ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_labels
text: ag_ff_summary table renamed labels.

title: Rename labels of a ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_labels
code: if (FALSE) { label_names <- c(   "Sepal.Length" = "Sepal length",   "Sepal.Width" = "Sepal width",   "Petal.Length" = "Petal length",   "Petal.Width" = "Petal width",   "Species" = "Species" )  ag_ff_summary(iris, "Species", table_vars_2) %>%   ag_ff_relocate("TGP") %>%   ag_ff_columns(levels = TRUE) %>%   ag_ff_labels(use_vector = TRUE, vector_name = label_names)  ag_ff_summary(iris, "Species", table_vars_2) %>%   ag_ff_relocate("TGP") %>%   ag_ff_columns(levels = TRUE) %>%   ag_ff_labels(use_excel = TRUE) }

what: Relocate columns of ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_relocate
title: Relocate columns of ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_relocate
text: function relocates columns finalfit summary table based specified order, considering different strata analysis options. primarily designed work datasets generated ag_ff_summary function.

title: Relocate columns of ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_relocate
code: ag_ff_relocate(.ff_table, order = NULL)

title: Relocate columns of ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_relocate
text: .ff_table input (ag_ff_summary table) modified. order Optional. order relocate columns. Default "GTP". Possible values : "G" (Groups), "GP" (Groups P-value), "GT" (Groups Total), "GTP" (Groups, Total, P-value), "TGP" (Total, Groups, P-value), "T" (Total). dataset 3 columns, means strata used, order argument needed.

title: Relocate columns of ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_relocate
text: Modified dataset relocated columns.

title: Relocate columns of ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_relocate
text: Ali Guner

title: Relocate columns of ag_ff_summary table — ag_ff_relocate
code: if (FALSE) { table_vars_1 <- penguins %>% dplyr::select(-species) %>% names()  ag_ff_summary(penguins, table_vars = table_vars_1) %>% ag_ff_relocate()  ag_ff_summary(penguins, "species", table_vars_1) %>% ag_ff_relocate("TGP") }

what: Enhanced version of summary_factorlist() function of `finalfit` — ag_ff_summary
title: Enhanced version of summary_factorlist() function of `finalfit` — ag_ff_summary
text: Generate aggregated summary statistics tests categorical continuous variables, option Fisher's correction contingency tables. function extends functionality summary_factorlist function introducing Shapiro-Wilk test selecting variables require Fisher's test. Normality distributions continuous variables evaluated Shapiro-Wilk test required test decided based test. categorical variables, expected cell frequencies calculated (expected cell frequencies less 5 20 contingency table may require using Fisher test) required test (Chi-square Fisher) decided based . row_col_sums function can used presenting different sum styles. default one, sums rows 100 approach good summary tables.

title: Enhanced version of summary_factorlist() function of `finalfit` — ag_ff_summary
code: ag_ff_summary(   .dataset,   strata = NULL,   table_vars,   row_col_sums = "row_col_based",   all_cont = "shapiro",   manual_nonparams = NULL,   fisher_correction = TRUE,   na_include = FALSE,   inverse_YN = FALSE,   summary_factorlist_args = list(),   ... )

title: Enhanced version of summary_factorlist() function of `finalfit` — ag_ff_summary
text: .dataset data frame containing variables interest. strata dependent variable (outcome) analysis, factor. table_vars character vector specifying explanatory variables (predictors) analysis. can factors, characters, numerics. row_col_sums character string specifying type summary statistics generated. Options include "row_based" row-based summaries, "col_based" column-based summaries, "row_col_based" row column-based summaries. Default "row_col_based". all_cont character string specifying approach continuous variables. Options include "parametric" parametric tests (mean), "nonparametric" non-parametric tests (median), "shapiro" using Shapiro-Wilk test normality choosing parametric non-parametric accordingly. Default "shapiro". Manual option also possible manual_nonparams. manual_nonparams all_cont set "manual", argument contain values (index, name variable) cont_nonpara. empty case. fisher_correction Logical, indicating whether Fisher's correction applied expected cell frequencies less 5 20 Default TRUE. na_include Logical, indicating whether missing values included analysis. Default TRUE. inverse_YN relevel Yes/factor levels row removal. Default TRUE. summary_factorlist_args list containing additional arguments passed ag_ff_summary. comes finalfit::summaryfactorlist function.                                Default empty list. ... Additional arguments passed ag_ff_summary.

title: Enhanced version of summary_factorlist() function of `finalfit` — ag_ff_summary
text: data frame containing aggregated summary statistics test results.

title: Enhanced version of summary_factorlist() function of `finalfit` — ag_ff_summary
text: Ali Guner

title: Enhanced version of summary_factorlist() function of `finalfit` — ag_ff_summary
code: if (FALSE) { # Example usage of ag_ff_summary function library(palmerpenguins)  table_vars_1 <- penguins %>% dplyr::select(-species) %>% names()  ag_ff_summary( .dataset = penguins, table_vars = table_vars_1, strata = "species" ) }

what: Identify Factors with Low Expected Cell Frequencies (for Fisher test) — ag_fisher
title: Identify Factors with Low Expected Cell Frequencies (for Fisher test) — ag_fisher
text: function performs contingency table analysis specified factor character variables given .dataset, option identify variables exhibiting expected cell frequencies less 5 20 designed handle potential issues gracefully, providing informative warnings excluding rows missing values strata variable necessary. function can display observed /expected values tables based user preferences.

title: Identify Factors with Low Expected Cell Frequencies (for Fisher test) — ag_fisher
code: ag_fisher(   .dataset,   strata,   table_vars,   silence = TRUE,   observed_tables = FALSE,   expected_tables = FALSE )

title: Identify Factors with Low Expected Cell Frequencies (for Fisher test) — ag_fisher
text: .dataset .dataset containing variables interest. strata stratifying factor variable analysis. table_vars character vector factor variable names analyze. silence Logical, indicating whether suppress warnings. Default TRUE. observed_tables Logical, indicating whether display contingency tables observed values. Default FALSE. expected_tables Logical, indicating whether display tables expected values. Default FALSE.

title: Identify Factors with Low Expected Cell Frequencies (for Fisher test) — ag_fisher
text: character vector factor variable names low expected cell frequencies, NULL none found.

title: Identify Factors with Low Expected Cell Frequencies (for Fisher test) — ag_fisher
text: Ali Guner

title: Identify Factors with Low Expected Cell Frequencies (for Fisher test) — ag_fisher
code: if (FALSE) { # Usage example: library(palmerpenguins)  table_vars <- penguins %>% dplyr::select(-species) %>% names()  strata <- "species"  ag_fisher(penguins, strata, table_vars,  silence = TRUE, observed_tables = TRUE) ag_fisher(penguins, strata, table_vars,   expected_tables = TRUE) }

title: Create a Styled Flextable — ag_flex
text: function generates styled flextable specified font family font size. flextable configured default font settings, 'theme_booktabs', additional styling make first row bold header.

title: Create a Styled Flextable — ag_flex
code: ag_flex(   .data,   flex_font_family = "Arial",   flex_font_size = 11,   color_header = TRUE )

title: Create a Styled Flextable — ag_flex
text: .data data frame tibble displayed flextable. flex_font_family Character, font family text flextable. flex_font_size Numeric, font size text flextable. color_header Logical. TRUE, default value, header blue background.

title: Create a Styled Flextable — ag_flex
text: flextable object customized styling.

title: Create a Styled Flextable — ag_flex
text: Ali Guner

title: Create a Styled Flextable — ag_flex
code: if (FALSE) { # Assuming you have a data frame named 'my_data' my_data %>% ag_flex() my_data %>% ag_flex(flex_font_family = "Times New Roman", flex_font_size = 14)  # If you want to undo bold() bold(i = 1, j = NULL, bold = FALSE, part = "header") }

what: Add Custom Headers (with n) to a flextable Object — ag_flex_header_labels
title: Add Custom Headers (with n) to a flextable Object — ag_flex_header_labels
text: function adds custom headers flextable object based specified dataset, strata variable, custom levels.

title: Add Custom Headers (with n) to a flextable Object — ag_flex_header_labels
code: ag_flex_header_labels(   flex_obj,   .dataset,   strata,   custom = FALSE,   custom_levels )

title: Add Custom Headers (with n) to a flextable Object — ag_flex_header_labels
text: flex_obj flextable object headers added. .dataset dataset used generating headers. strata name variable used grouping stratifying data. custom Logical value indicating whether use custom levels . custom_levels named vector specifying custom levels strata variable.

title: Add Custom Headers (with n) to a flextable Object — ag_flex_header_labels
text: flextable object custom headers added.

title: Add Custom Headers (with n) to a flextable Object — ag_flex_header_labels
text: Ali Guner

title: Add Custom Headers (with n) to a flextable Object — ag_flex_header_labels
code: if (FALSE) {  custom_levels <- c("Gentoo" = "MyGentoo", "Adelie" = "MyAdelie")  ag_ff_summary(penguins, "species", penguins %>% select(-species) %>% names()) %>%         ag_flex() %>%         ag_flex_header_labels(penguins, strata = "species", custom = TRUE, custom_levels = custom_levels)  }

what: Save a flextable as a Word document — ag_flex_save

title: Save a flextable as a Word document — ag_flex_save
code: ag_flex_save(   flex_obj,   n = "x",   orientation = "Landscape",   mypath = "_Outputs/_Tables" )

title: Save a flextable as a Word document — ag_flex_save
text: flex_obj flextable object saved. n table number identifier. Default "x". orientation orientation page. Can "Landscape" "Portrait". Default "Landscape". mypath path Word document saved. Default "_Outputs/_Tables" current working directory.

title: Save a flextable as a Word document — ag_flex_save
text: saved Word document.

title: Save a flextable as a Word document — ag_flex_save
text: Ali Guner

title: Save a flextable as a Word document — ag_flex_save

what: Generate Quarto Document Using Template — ag_generate_template_quarto
title: Generate Quarto Document Using Template — ag_generate_template_quarto
text: ag_generate_template_quarto() function creates new Quarto (.qmd) document using template file provided "RforMD" package. function simplifies process initializing Quarto projects customizable template.

title: Generate Quarto Document Using Template — ag_generate_template_quarto
code: ag_generate_template_quarto(name = "01 initial.qmd", open = interactive(), ...)

title: Generate Quarto Document Using Template — ag_generate_template_quarto
text: name character string specifying name output Quarto document. provided, default name "01 initial.qmd". open logical indicating whether open newly created Quarto document interactively. ... Additional arguments passed use_template function.

title: Generate Quarto Document Using Template — ag_generate_template_quarto
text: None

title: Generate Quarto Document Using Template — ag_generate_template_quarto
code: if (FALSE) { # Example usage ag_generate_template_quarto(name = "my_quarto_project.qmd", open = TRUE) }

title: Generate Dark-Light Colors — ag_make_colors
text: ag_make_colors function generates color palette consisting normal, darker, lighter colors based random hues.

title: Generate Dark-Light Colors — ag_make_colors
code: ag_make_colors(num_colors, seed = 2023)

title: Generate Dark-Light Colors — ag_make_colors
text: num_colors integer specifying number colors generate color palette. seed optional argument specifying seed random number generator. provided, default seed 2023 used.

title: Generate Dark-Light Colors — ag_make_colors
text: list following components (1000 different options defined): palette list containing color palette. color palette represented list following components: normal_color, darker_color, lighter_color. normal vector normal colors palette. darker vector darker colors palette. lighter vector lighter colors palette.

title: Generate Dark-Light Colors — ag_make_colors
text: Ali Guner

title: Generate Dark-Light Colors — ag_make_colors
code: if (FALSE) { # Generate a color palette with 5 colors using the default seed: colors <- ag_make_colors(5)  # Generate a color palette with 10 colors using a specific seed: colors <- ag_make_colors(10, seed = 1967)  # Extract the color palette palette <- colors$palette  # Extract the normal colors normal_colors <- colors$normal  # Extract the darker colors darker_colors <- colors$dark  # Extract the lighter colors lighter_colors <- colors$light }  #' @export

what: Extract indices for Non-Normally Distributed Variables — ag_non_param_vars
title: Extract indices for Non-Normally Distributed Variables — ag_non_param_vars
text: function serves helper finalfit functions, extracting indices non-normally distributed variables based Shapiro-Wilk test normality. utilizes `ag_shapiro` function specific parameters. Good use cont_nonpara argument summary_factorlist().

title: Extract indices for Non-Normally Distributed Variables — ag_non_param_vars
code: ag_non_param_vars(.dataset, strata = NULL, table_vars)

title: Extract indices for Non-Normally Distributed Variables — ag_non_param_vars
text: .dataset data frame containing variables interest. strata optional grouping variable stratified analysis. Default NULL. table_vars character vector variable names tested normality.

title: Extract indices for Non-Normally Distributed Variables — ag_non_param_vars
text: vector containing indices non-normally distributed variables.

title: Extract indices for Non-Normally Distributed Variables — ag_non_param_vars
text: Ali Guner

title: Extract indices for Non-Normally Distributed Variables — ag_non_param_vars
code: if (FALSE) { #' table_vars <- c("Sepal.Length", "Sepal.Width", "Petal.Length", "Petal.Width") or table_vars <- iris %>% dplyr::select(-Species) %>% names() dependent <- "Species"  ag_non_param_vars(.dataset = iris, strata = dependent, table_vars = table_vars ) }

text: list containing generated plot number missing values stratification variable (applicable).

what: Relabel a column in a dataset using an Excel file as a source of label mappings — ag_relabel_excel
title: Relabel a column in a dataset using an Excel file as a source of label mappings — ag_relabel_excel
text: function relabels specified column dataset replacing values corresponding labels Excel file. Excel file contain two columns: one original labels another new labels.

title: Relabel a column in a dataset using an Excel file as a source of label mappings — ag_relabel_excel
code: ag_relabel_excel(   .data,   label_column = "label",   excel_path,   sheet_name = "Sheet 1",   excel_old_names,   excel_new_names,   add_units = FALSE )

title: Relabel a column in a dataset using an Excel file as a source of label mappings — ag_relabel_excel
text: .data input dataset. label_column name column relabeled. Default "label". excel_path path Excel file. sheet_name name sheet Excel file containing label mappings. Default "Sheet 1". excel_old_names name column Excel file containing original labels. excel_new_names name column Excel file containing new labels. add_units Logical. TRUE, adds units information new labels based "units" column Excel file. Default FALSE.

title: Relabel a column in a dataset using an Excel file as a source of label mappings — ag_relabel_excel
text: modified dataset specified column relabeled.

title: Relabel a column in a dataset using an Excel file as a source of label mappings — ag_relabel_excel
code: if (FALSE) { relabeled_data <- ag_relabel_excel(.data = data, excel_path = "path/to/excel.xlsx",                                    excel_old_names = "original_labels",                                    excel_new_names = "new_labels",                                    add_units = TRUE) }

code: ag_relabel_vector(.data, label_column, vector_name)

title: Relabel a column using label mappings — ag_relabel_vector

text: modified dataset specified column relabeled.

title: Relabel a column using label mappings — ag_relabel_vector
text: Ali Guner

title: Relabel a column using label mappings — ag_relabel_vector
code: if (FALSE) { new_labels <- c(         "island" = "Island",         "flipper_length_mm" = "Flipper length (mm)",         "bill_depth_mm" = "Bill depth (mm)")  ag_ff_summary(penguins, strata = strata, table_vars = table_vars_penguins) %>%         ag_relabel_vector("label", new_labels) }

what: Perform Shapiro-Wilk Test for Normality — ag_shapiro
title: Perform Shapiro-Wilk Test for Normality — ag_shapiro
text: function conducts Shapiro-Wilk test normality numeric variables .dataset, either entire .dataset within specified strata. returns names counts variables found non-normally distributed based significance level 0.05. test, variables desired tests, defined explanatory vector.

title: Perform Shapiro-Wilk Test for Normality — ag_shapiro
code: ag_shapiro(   .dataset,   strata = NULL,   table_vars = NULL,   silence = FALSE,   names = TRUE )

title: Perform Shapiro-Wilk Test for Normality — ag_shapiro
text: .dataset data frame containing variables interest. strata optional grouping variable stratified analysis. Default NULL. table_vars character vector variable names tested normality. Can defined names(select()) functions. NULL, function use numeric variables .dataset, except strata present (RECOMMENDED, better idea define table_vars) silence Logical. FALSE, displays informative messages analysis. Default FALSE names Logical. TRUE, returns names non-normally distributed variables; FALSE, returns indices variables. Default TRUE

title: Perform Shapiro-Wilk Test for Normality — ag_shapiro
text: character vector containing names non-normally distributed variables integer count, based specified value 'names' argument.

title: Perform Shapiro-Wilk Test for Normality — ag_shapiro
text: Ali Guner

title: Perform Shapiro-Wilk Test for Normality — ag_shapiro
code: if (FALSE) {  table_vars <- c("Sepal.Length", "Sepal.Width", "Petal.Length", "Petal.Width") or table_vars <- iris %>% dplyr::select(-Species) %>% names() dependent <- "Species"  ag_shapiro(.dataset = iris, table_vars = table_vars) ag_shapiro(.dataset = iris, table_vars = table_vars, silence = TRUE, names = FALSE) }

title: Calculate Shapiro-Wilk p-values — ag_shapiro_results
text: function calculates Shapiro-Wilk p-values normality testing numeric variables .dataset.

title: Calculate Shapiro-Wilk p-values — ag_shapiro_results
code: ag_shapiro_results(   .dataset,   strata = NULL,   table_vars = NULL,   asteriks = TRUE,   scientific = FALSE )

title: Calculate Shapiro-Wilk p-values — ag_shapiro_results
text: .dataset input .dataset. strata (Optional) column name .dataset stratify analysis . Default NULL. table_vars character vector variable names include analysis. asteriks TRUE, test results reader-friendly. Default TRUE. scientific shapiro results formetted Scientific version? Default FALSE.

title: Calculate Shapiro-Wilk p-values — ag_shapiro_results
text: tibble columns variable names Shapiro-Wilk p-values.

title: Calculate Shapiro-Wilk p-values — ag_shapiro_results
code: if (FALSE) {  table_vars_1 <- penguins %>% dplyr::select(-species) %>% names()  ag_shapiro_results(penguins, "species", table_vars_1) }

title: AG Theme Customization — ag_theme
text: ag_theme() function defines custom theme ggplot2 plots specific styling preferences. theme enhances visual appeal consistency plots customizing various elements.

title: AG Theme Customization — ag_theme
code: ag_theme(my_plot_size = 12, my_font = "Arial", ...)

title: AG Theme Customization — ag_theme
text: my_plot_size Numeric, size text plot. my_font Character, font family text plot. ... additional arguments

title: AG Theme Customization — ag_theme
text: function returns ggplot2 theme object can applied ggplot objects achieve specified custom styling.

title: AG Theme Customization — ag_theme
text: theme includes following customizations: - Light background minimal grid lines (theme_light()). - Custom font family (Helvetica) size text elements. - Legends positioned top plot. - Adjusted sizes legend text, axis text, strip text. - Gray background facet strips. - Increased panel spacing removed panel borders. - Bold centrally aligned plot title, centered plot subtitle.

title: AG Theme Customization — ag_theme
text: Ali Guner

title: AG Theme Customization — ag_theme
code: if (FALSE) { # Example usage library(ggplot2) my_plot <- ggplot(data = my_data, aes(x = x_variable, y = y_variable)) +   geom_point() +   ag_theme() print(my_plot) }

what: Generate Row-, Column-based or both-based Summary Statistics — ff_row_col_sums
title: Generate Row-, Column-based or both-based Summary Statistics — ff_row_col_sums
text: function generates row column-based summary statistics based specified method.

title: Generate Row-, Column-based or both-based Summary Statistics — ff_row_col_sums
code: ff_row_col_sums(   .dataset,   strata = NULL,   table_vars = NULL,   na_include = NULL,   cont = NULL,   cont_nonpara = NULL,   fisher_correction = NULL,   row_col_sums,   ... )

title: Generate Row-, Column-based or both-based Summary Statistics — ff_row_col_sums
text: .dataset data frame containing variables interest. strata dependent variable hypothesis testing. table_vars vector explanatory variables analysis. na_include Logical. NA values included analysis? Default NULL. cont type measure continuous variables. Default NULL. cont_nonpara vector specifying non-parametric measures continuous variables. Default NULL. fisher_correction Logical. Fisher's exact tests corrected? Default NULL. row_col_sums method generating row column-based summary statistics. Use 'row_based' 'col_based'. ... Additional arguments passed underlying functions.

title: Generate Row-, Column-based or both-based Summary Statistics — ff_row_col_sums
text: summary factor list containing row column-based summary statistics.

title: Generate Row-, Column-based or both-based Summary Statistics — ff_row_col_sums
text: Ali Guner

title: Generate Row-, Column-based or both-based Summary Statistics — ff_row_col_sums
code: if (FALSE) { # Example usage of ff_row_col_sums function row_col_result <- ff_row_col_sums(my_data, strata, table_vars, row_col_sums = "row_based") }
